results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 037. Country jazz
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Bob Kingsbury and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The 25th Australian Jazz Convention, 1970, brought 600 musicians and enthusiasts to Dubbo, N.S.W. This annual event startled many of the local inhabitants, especially those who watched the parade of musicians down the main street. Featured artists and groups were the Original Graeme Bell Australian Jazz Band, Allan Stott’s Hottentots, Lachie Thompson’s New Whispering gold Orchestra, Nick Polites and his New Year’s Revllers and the Dubbo Corps Salvation Army Band.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Bob Kingsbury and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: The 25th Australian Jazz Convention, 1970, brought 600 musicians and enthusiasts to Dubbo, N.S.W. This annual event startled many of the local inhabitants, especially those who watched the parade of musicians down the main street. Featured artists and groups were the Original Graeme Bell Australian Jazz Band, Allan Stott’s Hottentots, Lachie Thompson’s New Whispering gold Orchestra, Nick Polites and his New Year’s Revllers and the Dubbo Corps Salvation Army Band.

results.title: Anzac: a nation's heritage
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Denys Brown, Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the landing by Australian and New Zealand troops on the Gallipoli Peninsula. Highlights include memorial services in Australia, New Zealand and Britain, a re-enactment at Anzac cove and scenes of Gallipoli and Troy today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Robinson, Denys Brown, Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: A commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the landing by Australian and New Zealand troops on the Gallipoli Peninsula. Highlights include memorial services in Australia, New Zealand and Britain, a re-enactment at Anzac cove and scenes of Gallipoli and Troy today.

results.title: Antarctic Vigil
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Dept of Interior for the Australian Film Board in association with The Australian National Anatarctic Research Expedition
results.brief_description: An account of research undertaken by Australian scientists at the Antarctic outposts of Macquarie, Kerguelen and Heard Islands. Shows life on these islands including work at the meteorological stations and studies of the unusual animal, bird and plant life found in Arctic regions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia and Dept of Interior for the Australian Film Board in association with The Australian National Anatarctic Research Expedition

results.title: Footprints on the Mountains
results.creator_credit: Denise Mack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: At age 11 Denise Mack is told secretly by her mother that her heritage isn’t Irish, that her grandfather was Lebanese and her grandmother, Chinese. Through this story, Denise journeys along the path of her ancestry to bring her closer to herself.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denise Mack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Jidi
results.creator_credit: Stephen Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Hyper-Ballad
results.creator_credit: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.

results.title: Hello Darling
results.creator_credit: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mike Helal left Lebanon at the height of the war and migrated to Melbourne. Reluctant to leave, Mike started to see the beauty of his new home. Despite this, nothing deters him as he waits to be reunited with his loved one again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Tripoli Melbourne & Me!
results.creator_credit: Dania Dabliz, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dania Dabliz’s life in Tripoli was full of fun, friends and parties. When she migrated to Melbourne she wondered if she would find the same things again?
